public enum MoveDirection
extends java.lang.Enum<MoveDirection>

Eight cardinal directions.

Version:
1.0
Author:
frank hadder, frank.hadder@gmail.com

getDirection

public static MoveDirection getDirection(int value)
Gets a move direction from an integer value. Expects an integer between 0-7. This is inteded to help get a random MoveDirection.

Parameters:
value - an integer between 0-7.
Returns:
the MoveDirection that corresponds to the given integer value

getDirectionFromDegrees

public static MoveDirection getDirectionFromDegrees(double degrees)
Gets the cardinal direction at the specified degrees. For example, 90 degrees will return MoveDirection.North.

Parameters:
degrees - the amount of degrees to translate into the cardinal direction.
Returns:
the cardinal direction at the specified degrees.

getDirectionFromRadians

public static MoveDirection getDirectionFromRadians(double radians)
Gets the cardinal direction at the specified radians. For example, 3.14 radians will return MoveDirection.West.

Parameters:
radians - the amount of radians to translate into the cardinal direction.
Returns:
the cardinal direction at the specified radian.

flipDirectionHorizontal

public MoveDirection flipDirectionHorizontal()
This will return the direction flipped horizontally. For example, NorthEast will be fliped to NorthWest.

Returns:
the horizontally flipped direction.

flipDirectionVertical

public MoveDirection flipDirectionVertical()
This will return the direction flipped Vertically. For example, NorthEast will be fliped to SouthEast.

Returns:
the vertically flipped direction.

getStartDegrees

public double getStartDegrees()
This will return the starting degrees of this MoveDirection. For example, MoveDirection.North.getStartDegrees() will return 67.5 degrees.

Returns:
the degrees that start the MoveDirection.

getEndDegrees

public double getEndDegrees()
This will return the ending degrees of this MoveDirection. For example, MoveDirection.North.getEndDegrees() will return 112.5 degrees.

Returns:
the degrees that end the MoveDirection.
